page.title: 13St Giles Church Tattenhoe
page.content: We went inside the church, it was a small room measuring 42ft by 14ft. It isuilt of stone supported by brick buttresses,two of them were built in the fifteenth century.It has a wooden turret on the West side which contains a bell. The bell has an inscription which says PETROS DEVESTON ME FECIT which indicates that there was a church on the site in 1347. However, the present church was built in 1540 out of the ruins of Snelshall Priory. In 1960 new roof was put on the church. It was noted that the wood in the old church was Deal. The walls in the church have pinkish wash on them and the eight mullioned windows are white. In the North wall is a small alcove and there are traces of a door.
